projects.name: Kiwa
overview: Kiwa is an Asian fusion restaurant based in Aix-en-Provence, France.
Built with React.js and the popular UI library @shadcn/ui, the website features a monochrome colour scheme to draw visitors' attention to the restaurant's catering services.
responsibilities: I was the sole developer of this project.
I was responsible for every aspect of the website, including but not limited to: design, functionality, performance, layout, and accessibility.

The website makes use of a proprietary internationalisation implementation. It also uses the new Chrome View Transitions API, allowing seamless transitions such as switching between dark and light modes.

projects.name: Unbound
overview: Unbound is an open-source modification designed to add functionality to the Discord mobile app with unprecedented levels of customization. Offering a rich array of features from plug-ins to themes, fonts, and icon packs with a write once run everywhere approach, Unbound redefines the user experience, providing a platform agnostic experience for personalization unlike any other.
responsibilities: As the lead developer and owner of Unbound, I handled key technical aspects of the project, including reverse-engineering the Discord mobile app to enable features like plug-ins, themes, and icon packs.

I developed loaders for code execution, created bundle patchers for app executables, and ensured compatibility across platforms. I worked with team members on the client bundle, making design decisions to enhance both user and developer experience. I also managed the team to ensure we delivered a consistent product across all platforms.

projects.name: Enmity
overview: Enmity is an open-source modification designed to add functionality to the Discord's iOS mobile app. Enmity offers both plug-ins to themes, providing a foundation for personalization and extended functionality.
responsibilities: I was responsible for key components of Enmity such as the client itself along with the loader.
Moreover, I handled the key part of Enmity's functionality, the loader. This tool injects the client JavaScript bundle, allowing access to Discord APIs and setting up a base for plugin developers.
